text: hi everyone today I will be making
another very popular strict snack in Ho
Chi Minh City with Chinese influence is
called Bob King or button Bob King this
is how is repaired by natural street
vendor in Ho Chi Minh City the dough a
pan fried to a crisp on the outside
yes use salt and water on the inside
they use a very large cast iron pan to
achieve that crispiness then the
scramble eggs to buy the crispy fried
all together and topped with chopped
spring onion for more deliciousness
assistant served on a plate top with
shredded green papaya or carrot and
daikon pickles this dish looks really
simple but it's very addictive so I'm
sure you're gonna like it
let's begin
to make the job you will need 1 cup of
rice flour 1 tablespoon of tapioca
starch and 1 and 1/2 cup water also add
in a teaspoon of vegetable oil a quarter
teaspoon of salt then stir well to
dissolve you can let the dough rest for
about half an hour to reduce the strong
flour smell then stir well and microwave
for 2 minutes the batter will look like
this you will whisk to stir it up then
put it into a microwave again for
another 1 minute check out stir it up
one more time and then microwave for the
last 1 minute that means in total you
need 4 minutes to turn the batter into a
half cooked paste this stuff is very
important to have a smooth piece of rice
flour cake if you steam the batter right
away with them making the paste the
flour tends to settle at the bottom
making the rice flour cake not evenly
cooked traditionally the pasty made by
constantly stirring the butter in a
saucepan on the stove you can take a
look at my buns your video to see if how
it is made on the stove it's a lot
easier with the microwave I must say ok
so just start up well and transfer to a
mold greased with some vegetable oil if
you don't have a square mole it's okay
just to you a normal round plate your
spatula or a spoon to flatten the
surface then steam for about 30 to 40
minutes if you don't have a steamer like
this you can watch my other video to see
how I set up a steamer on the stove when
you insert a toothpick in the center of
the cake and it's come out clean that
mean it's cooked when it's still hot it
look kind of soft let it come completely
and chill in the fridge overnight the
doll tends to be crispier after
refrigeration you can see here is really
smooth and see
okay right this cake is enough for two
serving portions I'm cutting half of the
cake into small rectangular cubes around
the side of a terminal then transfer it
to a bowl and mix with a teaspoon of
black soy sauce if you don't like your
dough to be black just keep it to make
the pecos mix 1 cup of shredded carrot
and daikon with 2 tbsp of sugar and 3
tablespoon of white vinegar mix well and
set aside for about 15 minutes to make a
dipping sauce mix 2 tablespoon of light
soy sauce with a tablespoon of white
vinegar or black vinegar and a
tablespoon of sugar let's start frying
in a heavy skillet add in 1 tablespoon
of vegetable oil then pan fry the dal
for about 5 to 7 minutes on each side or
until it is crispy golden brown
I think the street vendor fry the dal
two times to achieve that extra
crispiness meaning the dough that she
used was already pre fried 1 then crack
2 eggs and break the yolks and if your
spatulas to buy all the crispy cubes
together then sprinkle a lot of chopped
spring onion on top the contrast of
color and texture of this dish is really
a dream
then flip it over and fry for one to two
more minutes until the egg is completely
cooked then transfer it to a plate and
top up with that sweet and sour pickles
to serve drizzle with some of the spicy
sour savory sauce and stir it up let me
give it a try mmm so good especially
with some extra sweet chili sauce if you
liked this recipe don't forget to thumbs
up and subscribe to my channel for more
delicious Vietnamese bun thank you for
watching bye bye
you
